meanings.definition: to remove material that is considered improper or offensive from a text
meanings.sent1: The teacher bowdlerises the story before reading it to the class.
meanings.sent2: The editor bowdlerises the article to make it suitable for all readers.
meanings.sent3: The librarian bowdlerises the book, making sure it is appropriate for young readers.
meanings.sent4: She carefully bowdlerises the movie script to comply with the censorship guidelines.
meanings.sent5: The parent bowdlerises the bedtime story, skipping over the parts that are too scary.

meanings.definition: to censor or edit a text for moral reasons
meanings.sent1: The committee bowdlerises the play to ensure it aligns with their values.
meanings.sent2: The author bowdlerises the novel to avoid offending certain groups.
meanings.sent3: The student bowdlerises the essay, removing any language that could be seen as disrespectful.
meanings.sent4: He bowdlerises his social media posts to maintain a positive online image.
meanings.sent5: The government bowdlerises the speech to control the message being conveyed.
